articles.title: Kim Jong Il Enjoys Art Performance Given by Employees of CBCK
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Enjoys Art Performance Given by Employees of CBCK
Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, enjoyed a performance given by the art squad of the Central Broadcasting Committee of Korea on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the Korean Central Broadcasting. 
					 Put on the stage were such colorful numbers of various genres as poem and story-telling "The Three Commanders of Mt. Paektu and Broadcasting of Korea", mixed quartet and chorus "Glory to Our Great Party," female sextet "If Our Mother Party Wishes", drama taken from real story "Chon Bok and Man Kil 'Fuse'", drum beating and singing "It Is Offensive", witticism "Ttolttoli and Samnyo 'Let Us Focus'" and chorus "The DPRK Does If It Is Determined."
					
					 The performers enthusiastically sang of the shining course covered by the Juche broadcasting of the DPRK over the last 65 years under the leadership of the party and the leader and their great pride and happiness of conducting worthwhile media activities under the loving care of Kim Jong Il. They successfully represented the firm faith and will of the broadcasting personnel to live and struggle as eternal companions of the WPK who share destiny with it to the last.
					
					 Kim Jong Il waved back to the enthusiastically cheering performers and audience and congratulated the performers on their successful presentation.
					
					 He expressed great satisfaction over the fact that the employees of the CBCK staged a splendid performance replete with the spirit of the era with numbers of great cognitional and instructive value as it truthfully reflected their life by earnestly learning from the soldier culture created in the era of Songun. He highly appreciated the success made in the performance and extended thanks to the performers. 
					
					 Our media persons are now enthusiastically praising the WPK's Songun idea, the Songun politics, deeply aware of the mission and duty they have assumed before the times and the revolution, and remaining loyal to its leadership, he said, adding with pride that the WPK is highly proud of having such trustworthy media persons. 
					
					 He highly appreciated the successes made by the broadcasting personnel of the CBCK, noting that they defended the party and the leader politically and ideologically and positively encouraged the army and people of the DPRK in their drive to accomplish the cause of building a thriving nation, tightly holding the pens and microphones of the revolution either in those glorious days or days of stern trials.
					
					 When the media become alive with activities, the whole country seethes with a revolutionary surge and when the hearts of the journalists and other media persons burn with enthusiasm, the mental power of all the servicepersons and people is fully displayed at present, the historic juncture when a decisive turn is taking place in the efforts to accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche and the cause of building a thriving socialist nation, he said, setting forth highly important tasks to be fulfilled by them.
					
					 Among the audience were Kim Ki Nam and Hong Sok Hyong, members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK, Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC of the DPRK, Pak To Chun, Choe Ryong Hae and Thae Jong Su, alternate members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK, and commanding officers of the KPA.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance Given by Art Squad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance Given by Art Squad
Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, enjoyed a performance given by the art squad of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League. 
					 Put on the stage were poem reciting "Youth League of the Three Commanders of Mt. Paektu", mixed chorus "Glory to Our Great Party," mixed duet "Let's Youth Go ahead Guided by the Party", dramatic witty talk "It Is Endless," female duet and pangchang "Charm and Reverence," chorus and story telling "The Way We Want to Follow," dance "We Like Our Style" and small chorus "The DPRK Does If It Is Determined" and other colorful numbers of diverse genres.
					
					 The performers proudly sang of the shining history of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League in which it has dynamically advanced along the road of victory and glory under the leadership of the party and the leader and feats performed by the young people while playing the role of a shock brigade in the defence of the country and in all the fields of the socialist construction. They truthfully represented the firm faith and will of the five million members of the young vanguard to accomplish generation after generation the revolutionary cause of Juche that started in the forest of Mt. Paektu and become human bullets and bombs devotedly protecting Kim Jong Il.  
					
					 He waved back to the enthusiastically cheering performers and audience and congratulated the performers on their successful presentation. 
					
					 He expressed great satisfaction over the fact that the members of the art squad staged a splendid performance rich in its ideological contents and high in artistry by creating numbers which are suited to the characteristic features of the young people and of great cognitional and instructive value. He highly appreciated their success in the performance and extended thanks to them.   
					
					 The revolutionary cause of Juche pioneered by the forerunners is given steady continuity as the young people, the most vital militant force, are creditably playing a main role in the defence of the country and the socialist construction, he said, adding that it is the great pride of the WPK to have such reliable large contingent of young people who like to make the revolution and struggle. 
					
					 Noting that the art squad is playing a role on the ideological front for fully preparing the young people, the younger generation, as successors to the revolution intensely loyal to the party and the revolution, he advanced the important tasks to be carried out to create art and conduct performing activities.  
					
					 Among the audience were Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok and Hong Sok Hyong, members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK, Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-premier of the Cabinet, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC of the DPRK, Choe Ryong Hae, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, Ri Yong Chol, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, and leading officials of the C.C., the WPK.

articles.title: Art Performance Given
articles.content:
Art Performance Given
Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- A performance of the art squad of the Central Broadcasting Committee of Korea was given at the Mansudae Art Theatre Saturday to mark the 65th anniversary of the Korean Central Broadcasting.
					 It was enjoyed by senior state officials, the chairman of a friendly party, officials of public organizations, ministries and national institutions and those of party and administrative bodies in Pyongyang.
					
					 Put on the stage were colorful items such as poem and tale "The Three Commanders of Mt. Paektu and Broadcasting of Korea", chorus "Forty Million People Sing of the Leader", mixed quartette and chorus "Glory to Our Great Party" and narrative poem and song "We Sing of the Benevolent Embrace".
					
					 The performers made vivid representation of the great pride and happiness of announcers, journalists, editors and employees who uphold the cause of the Workers' Party of Korea and the leader with loyalty while firmly holding the writing pens and microphones of the revolution after growing up under the care of the peerlessly great persons.
					
					 Such items as singing in unison while beating drums "It Is Offensive", drama taken from real story "Chon Bok and Man Kil 'Fuse'" and witticism "Ttolttoli and Samnyo 'Let Us Focus'" gave deep impressions to the audience for reflection of spirit of the era.
					
					 The performance was acclaimed by the audience as it dealt with validity and vitality of the WPK's line on mass-based culture and performing activities and noble mental world of media persons of the Songun era who are displaying their honor as trumpeters sounding advance in building a thriving nation.

articles.title: Jo Myong Rok Dies
articles.content:
Jo Myong Rok Dies
Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Jo Myong Rok, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, first vice-chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly, died of an inveterate heart disease at 10:30 a.m. on Nov. 6, Juche 99 (2010) at the age of 82 to our sorrow.
					 Born into a poor peasant's family in Yonsa County, North Hamgyong Province on July 12, Juche 17 (1928) Jo Myong Rok was a revolutionary comrade loyal to General Secretary Kim Jong Il and a prominent activist of the WPK, the state and the army of the DPRK who devoted his whole life to the sacred struggle for the freedom and independence of the country and the victory of the cause of socialism.
					
					 He grew up to be an able military and political official under the care of the party and the leader after the country's liberation.
					
					 He worked for years at important posts of the party, the state and the army.
					
					 In the period of the hard-fought Fatherland Liberation War against the U.S. imperialists' armed invasion he bravely fought as a pilot of the KPA for the victory in the war. He worked hard for the development of the air force, holding posts of squadron commander, group commander and divisional commander of an air unit and the chief of the staff and commander of the air force of the KPA in the post-war period. 
					
					 Holding important posts as the director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA from October, Juche 84 (1995) and first vice- chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission from September, Juche 87 (1998), he energetically worked to thoroughly implement the Juche-oriented military line of the WPK and firmly guarantee the building of a thriving nation and the victory of the revolutionary cause of Juche with matchless military power.
					
					 He was elected alternate member of the C.C., the WPK in November, Juche 64 (1975), member of the C.C., the WPK and member of the Central Military Commission of the WPK in October, Juche 69 (1980) and member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK in September, Juche 99 (2010) and worked as a deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly from the sixth Supreme People's Assembly held in November, Juche 66 (1977).
					
					 He was awarded Order of Kim Il Sung, the highest order of the DPRK, the titles of Hero of the DPRK and Labour Hero and many other orders and medals including Order of National Flag First Class and Order of Freedom and Independence First Class for the distinguished feats he performed for the party and the revolution, the country and its people.
					
					 He received the title of vice marshal of the KPA in October, Juche 84 (1995).
					
					 An obituary of Jo Myong Rok was jointly issued by the C.C., the WPK, the Central Military Commission of the WPK, the DPRK National Defence Commission and the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly on Saturday.
					
					 The obituary said that his death is a great loss to the party, the army and people of the DPRK waging a dynamic struggle to win the victory of the cause of building a thriving socialist nation and bring earlier the independent reunification of the country. Though he passed away, the exploits he performed for the party and the revolution, the country and its people will shine long along with the victorious advance of the revolutionary cause of Juche, it stressed.
					
					 On the same day, the C.C., the WPK, the Central Military Commission of the WPK, the DPRK National Defence Commission and the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly announced that the late Jo Myong Rok would be accorded a state funeral and formed a state funeral committee with Kim Jong Il as its chairman and Kim Jong Un and 169 others as its members. 
					
					 The state funeral committee informed the public that the bier of the deceased would be placed in the Central Hall of Workers, it would receive mourners from 10:00 on Nov. 8 to 18:00 on Nov. 9 and the hearse would leave the hall at 9 a.m. on Nov. 10.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Visits Jilin Yuwen Middle School
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Visits Jilin Yuwen Middle School
Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- Choe Yong Rim, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and premier of the Cabinet of the DPRK, and his party on an unofficial working visit to the northeastern region of China visited Jilin Yuwen Middle School on Nov. 5.
					 They laid a floral basket before the statue of President Kim Il Sung at the school and paid tribute to him.
					
					 Being briefed on the historical mementoes including a desk and a chair the President used in his schooldays, they went round the interior of the school preserved to its original state.
					
					 The premier wrote in the visitor's book that he hoped Jilin Yuwen Middle School associated with the revolutionary feats of the President and the revolutionary history of General Secretary Kim Jong Il would remain a model of the traditional DPRK-China friendship and train more talents needed for the modernization drive in China. 
					
					 The premier and his party made the rounds of the Harbin Electrical Group, the Harbin Huijiang Foodstuff Company, the Changchun Rolling Stock Company, the Changchun Agricultural Expo, the Jilin Chemical Fiber Group, the Yaowang Shrine in the Beishan Park, which Kim Jong Il visited last August and various other places of Harbin City of Heilongjiang Province and Changchun and Jilin cities of Jilin Province.
					
					 Meanwhile, the premier separately met and had conversations in a friendly atmosphere with Ji Bingxuan, secretary of the Heilongjiang Provincial Committee of the Communist Party of China, Wang Xiankui, acting governor of the Heilongjiang Provincial People's Government, Sun Zhengcai, secretary of the Jilin Provincial Committee of the CPC, Wang Yulin, governor of the Jilin Provincial People's Government, and other officials of the Harbin and Changchun city committees of the CPC and the city people's governments concerned.
					
					 Present there were the premier's party and Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK.
					
					 During their stay the premier and his party were entertained to the banquets given in the joint name of the Heilongjiang and Jilin provincial committees of the CPC, the Harbin and Jilin city committees of the CPC and the people's governments concerned.

articles.title: Li Changchun Meets Delegation of Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Li Changchun Meets Delegation of Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- Li Changchun, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, met and had a friendly talk with the delegation of Rodong Sinmun headed by its Editor-in-chief Kim Ki Ryong on a visit to China at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing Friday. 
					 Present there were Zhang Yannong, president, Wu Hengquan, editor-in-chief, and He Chongyuan, vice-president, of Renmin Ribao, and Ji Jae Ryong, DPRK ambassador to China.
					
					 Kim Ki Ryong conveyed the greetings from General Secretary Kim Jong Il to Hu Jintao and Li Changchun.
					
					 Li Changchun expressed deep thanks for this and requested the head of the delegation to convey General Secretary Hu Jintao's warm regards and his own to General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He recalled with deep emotion the facts that he was received by President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il when he visited the DPRK several times.
					
					 Kim Jong Il visited China twice this year and exchanged with Hu Jintao views on developing the relations between the two parties and countries and other issues of common concern and reached a consensus on them, he said, adding that this gave further impetus to the development of the Sino-DPRK friendly relations.
					
					 The Workers' Party of Korea founded by Kim Il Sung is the one with glorious revolutionary traditions and strong fighting efficiency, he said, stressing that the Korean people have achieved big progress in the revolution and construction under the leadership of the WPK.
					
					 He hoped that the Korean people would achieve greater successes in the building of a great prosperous and powerful nation under the leadership of the WPK headed by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It is the invariable policy of the party and government of China to steadily consolidate and develop the traditional Sino-DPRK friendship, he noted, expressing belief that the relations between the two parties and countries would develop on a higher stage thanks to the concerted efforts of the two sides.
					
					 Meanwhile, Wang Jiarui, head of the International Liaison Department of the C.C., the Communist Party of China, met the delegation and had a talk in a friendly atmosphere on the same day.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Raul Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Raul Castro Ruz 
Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a message of sympathy to Raul Castro Ruz, president of the Council of State and president of the Council of Ministers of Cuba, in connection with a plane crash that happened in Cuba on November 4, claiming big casualties. 
					 In the message Kim expressed deep sympathy and consolation to the victims and their bereaved families, hoping that the president of the Council of Ministers and the government of Cuba would eradicate the aftermath of the accident as early as possible.

articles.title: DPRK Military Delegation Returns
articles.content:
DPRK Military Delegation Returns
Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA)  - The DPRK military delegation led by Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Ri Yong Ho, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea and chief of the General Staff of the KPA, came back home on Saturday after visiting Cuba.

articles.title: Vietnamese Prime Minister on Closer Cooperation with DPRK
articles.content:
Vietnamese Prime Minister on Closer Cooperation with DPRK
Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- Ma Chol Su, DPRK ambassador to Vietnam, paid a farewell call on Nguyen Tan Dung, prime minister of the government of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, on Nov. 2.
					 The prime minister said that the party, government and people of Vietnam are pleased that the Workers' Party of Korea, government and people of the DPRK successfully held the WPK Conference, significantly commemorated the 65th birthday of the WPK and made great successes in all the fields of socialist construction. 
					
					 He expressed hope that the peoples of Vietnam and the DPRK would boost the cooperation in all fields in their mutual interests as old friends.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Immortal Revolutionary Exploits Lauded
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Immortal Revolutionary Exploits Lauded
Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- Bui Van Nam, deputy minister of Public Security of Vietnam, expressed profound reverence for President Kim Il Sung, when he was visiting the DPRK at the head of the delegation of the Ministry of Public Security of Vietnam.
					　He said:
					
					　President Kim Il Sung made a great contribution to the cause for the country and its people.
					
					　The Korean people became a proud and dignified people as they were led by the great leader.
					
					　Our visits to the old home of Kim Il Sung in Mangyongdae and the Kumsusan Memorial Palace provided us with opportunities to know better about the revolutionary history of the President. 
					
					　Visiting the International Friendship Exhibition, we keenly realized how ardently the world progressive people venerate Kim Il Sung. 
					
					　The gifts on display clearly show his high international prestige.
					
					　He enjoys boundless trust from all people.
					
					　Kim Il Sung was a comrade dear to the Vietnamese people.
					
					　He extended unstinted support and encouragement to our people during the Vietnam war.
					
					　The Vietnamese people will always remember this.
					
					　The friendly relations between the two countries have more dynamically developed since the historic Pyongyang meeting of Nong Duc Manh and General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					　While staying in the DPRK we witnessed the achievements made by the Korean people in socialist construction.
					
					　We are sure that the Korean people will surely open the gate to a great prosperous and powerful nation under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Event Held at Chinese School
articles.content:
Event Held at Chinese School
Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- An event took place at Beijing Middle School No. 5 in China on November 2 to commemorate the diamond jubilee of naming a class of the school Kim Il Sung Class. 
					Present there were teaching staff of the school, students and graduates from the class and Wu Donghe, chairman of the Sino-Korea Friendship Association.
					
					Present there on invitation were Ji Jae Ryong, DPRK ambassador to China, and a friendly delegation led by Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the DPRK-China Friendship Association, on a visit to China to attend the celebrations of the anniversary.
					
					A gift sent by General Secretary Kim Jong Il to the school was conveyed at the event.
					
					Also handed there were a congratulatory message of the Central Committee of the DPRK-China Friendship Association and a silk banner of the Mao Zedong Class of East Pyongyang Secondary School No. 1.
					
					Speeches were made by the principal of Beijing Middle School No. 5, the principal of East Pyongyang Secondary School No. 1, a representative of the students of the Kim Il Sung Class and a representative of the graduates from it and a representative of the students of the Mao Zedong Class at the event.
					
					Speakers said that it is of particularly weighty significance to commemorate the 60th anniversary of the naming of the class at a time when the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and China reached a fresh high stage under the deep care of the top leaders of the two countries. 
					
					They expressed their determination to always consolidate and develop generation after generation the DPRK-China friendship, a precious legacy provided and bequeathed by the leaders of the elder generation of the two countries.
					
					Then followed an art performance given by students of Beijing Middle School No. 5.
					
					A friendly meeting took place at the DPRK embassy in Beijing on the occasion of the said anniversary on the same day.

articles.title: Efficacious Koryo Medicines Manufactured
articles.content:
Efficacious Koryo Medicines Manufactured
Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- Koryo medicines manufactured by the Korea Jangsaeng J.V. Company are enjoying increasing popularity among Korean people.
					 Among the medicines are Phasok capsules efficacious for nephrolithiasis and cholelithiasis and Omija-magamok (Schizandra chinensis and Sorbus commixta) capsules for respiratory trouble.
					
					 The company is well known at home and abroad for good medicines.
					
					 Kumintungunal, a specific remedy for liver disease, was awarded a gold prize and diploma at the International Exhibition of Health Food and Medicines held in Vietnam in October Juche 95 (2006) and a crystal cup at the International Fair of Trade and Economic Cooperation held in China in August 2007.
					
					 The company also manufactures such patent medicines as Tetrodocain injection, a strong antibiotic and anodyne, and PBIOR-1 injection, polybiorestoractive.
					
					 Chae Hui Gyong, a section chief of the company and a developer of the remedies, told the KCNA she would develop more Koryo medicines in line with the policy of the Workers' Party of Korea on public health.

articles.title: Japanese Militarists' Moves to Stage Comeback to Korea under Fire
articles.content:
Japanese Militarists' Moves to Stage Comeback to Korea under Fire
Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- The Japanese militarists had better stop their rash acts but behave themselves if they do not want to suffer another bitter defeat, warns Rodong Sinmun Saturday in a signed article.
					 Recalling that the Japanese militarists are more openly rushing headlong into reinvasion, the article says that this is evidenced by the fact that the Maritime "Self-Defence Force" of Japan participated in the recent PSI joint naval exercises conducted by the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean warmongers in waters off Pusan.
					
					 What merits a more serious attention is that the Japanese militarists are regarding the tripartite military maneuvers involving the U.S., Japan and south Korea as a golden opportunity for staging a comeback to Korea, zealously pursuant to the U.S. imperialists' policy of aggression towards the DPRK. 
					
					 The Japanese authorities are citing "threat" from someone to justify their moves to turn their country into a military giant. 
					
					 But there is no country in Asia which poses a threat to Japan. On the contrary, Japan is waiting for a chance to launch reinvasion of Asia including Korea while getting frantic with its moves to beef up its military muscle and enact a war legislation. 
					
					 The participation of the MSDF in the recent joint naval exercises suggests that the Japanese militarists seek to get a big profit from the second Korean war, if it is ignited by the U.S. imperialists just as they did during the past Korean war.
					
					 Herein lie the potential danger and gravity of the Japanese militarist forces' moves for reinvasion.
					
					 The Japanese militarist forces are working hard to realize the old dream of the "Greater East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere" through the zealous pursuance of the U.S. imperialists' Asian policy of aggression but it is a foolish pipe dream.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Talk about "Principal Enemy" Censured
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Talk about "Principal Enemy" Censured
Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- The talk about the "principal enemy", a stumbling block lying in the way of reconciliation and unity, should never be allowed in the present era which calls for achieving reunification and prosperity by the concerted efforts of the Koreans as it is a leftover of the old era of confrontation.
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday observes this in a signed article.
					
					 Shortly ago the south Korean military released and distributed what it called a "2010 report on army policy" in which the conception that "the north is the principal enemy" is clearly stipulated in the wake of the call made by the ultra-right conservatives of the "Grand National Party" for labeling the north as "the principal enemy" in the "white paper for national defence" for this year, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The "principal enemy" touted by the south Korean conservative group is a treacherous watchword for confrontation denying the national reconciliation and unity and fostering and aggravating the mistrust and confrontation between Koreans as it clearly reveals their conception of hostility towards the DPRK.
					
					 The homogenous Korean nation desires reconciliation and unity, not confrontation, and hopes for peace and prosperity common to the nation, not a war, as it has lived in harmony in the same territory for 5000 years.
					
					 But the south Korean conservative group's loudmouthed "principal enemy" totally denies this fact. 
					
					 In a word, its much touted "principal enemy" defines fellow countrymen as the people with whom it should stand in confrontation and who should be destroyed by force of arms, not as the people with whom reconciliation and unity should be achieved. This conception is rebuffed and denounced by all the Koreans as it is a call for confrontation and war against reunification quite contrary to the June 15 era of reunification.
					
					 The above-said conception is nothing but one of confrontation and war which drives the inter-Korean relations to collapse and increases the danger of a war of aggression against the DPRK.
					
					  It is preposterous for the south Korean ruling forces to talk about dialogue and the improved inter-Korean relations while noisily trumpeting about the "principal enemy" and crying out for confrontation. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities would be well advised to stop at once the row about the "principal enemy" and sincerely respond to the DPRK's efforts for reconciliation, cooperation, peace and reunification.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim y su comitiva visitan Escuela Secundaria Yuwen de China
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim y su comitiva visitan Escuela Secundaria Yuwen de China 
Pyongyang, 6 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Choe Yong Rim, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, de visita de trabajo no oficial en la region nordeste de China, y su comitiva visitaron el dia 5 la Escuela Secundaria Yuwen de Jilin.
					　Ante todo, ellos rindieron tributo al Presidente Kim Il Sung tras depositar un cesto de flores ante su estatua de bronce erguida en la escuela. 
					
					　Escuchando las explicaciones sobre los objetos historicos, incluso el pupitre y la silla usados por el Presidente cuando estudiaba en la escuela, los visitantes recorrieron el interior de ella que se conserva en estado original.
					
					　El premier coreano escribio en el libro de visitas que desea que la Escuela Secundaria Yuwen de Jilin, donde estan registradas las proezas revolucionarias del Presidente y la historia revolucionaria del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, sea modelo de la tradicional amistad Corea-China y forme mucho mas personal competente necesario a la modernizacion de China. 
					
					　El premier y su comitiva hicieron recorrido por varios lugares de la ciudad de Harbin de la provincia de Heilongjiang y las ciudades de Changchun y Jilin de la provincia de Jilin como el Grupo Electrico de Harbin, la Compania de Alimentos Huijiang de Harbin, la Compania de Vagones de Changchun, la Exposicion Agricola de Changchun, el Grupo de Fibra Quimica de Jilin, el templo Yaowangmiao en el Parque Beishan, etc. siguiendo el itinerario recorrido por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il en agosto pasado.
					
					   Por otra parte, el premier coreano departio por separado en el ambiente amistoso con el secretario del Comite Provincial del PCCh en Heilongjiang, Ji Bingxuan, el gobernador interino del Gobierno Popular de la misma provincia, Wang Xiankui, el secretario del Comite Provincial del PCCh en Jilin, Sun Zhengcai, el gobernador del Gobierno Popular de la misma provincia Wang Yulin y otros funcionarios de los comites municipales del PCCh y los comites populares municipales de Harbin y Changchun. 
					
					　Estuvieron presentes en estas ocasiones la comitiva del premier coreano y el embajador chino en Corea Liu Hongcai.
					
					　Durante su estancia, Choe y sus acompanantes fueron invitados a los banquetes ofrecidos a nombre comun de los comites provinciales del Partido Comunista de China en Heilongjiang y Jilin y los municipales del PCCh en Harbin y Jilin y los gobiernos populares de las mismas provincias y ciudades.

articles.title: Li Changchun se reune con la delegacion de Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Li Changchun se reune con la delegacion de Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, 6 de noviembre (ATCC) -- El miembro del Comite Permanente del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China, Li Changchun, departio el dia 5 en un ambito amistoso con la delegacion del diario Rodong Sinmun encabezada por el editor jefe, Kim Ki Ryong, de visita en China, en el Gran Palacio del Pueblo de Beijing.
					  En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el director del diario Renmin Ribao, Zhang Yannong, el redactor en jefe, el redactor jefe adjunto, He Chongyuan, y el embajador coreano en China, Ji Jae Ryong.
					
					  Kim Ki Ryong transmitio el saludo del Dirigente   Kim Jong Il enviado a los camaradas Hu Jintao y Li Changchun.
					
					  Li Changchun expreso profundo agradecimiento al respecto y pidio al jefe de la delegacion coreana que extienda al Secretario General Kim Jong Il el saludo cordial del Secretario General Hu Jintao y de si mismo.
					
					  Li Changchun recordo con gran emocion que fue recibido por el Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il durante sus varias visitas a Corea.
					
					  Dijo que el Dirigente visito este ano dos veces a China, intercambio con el Secretario General Hu Jintao las opiniones sobre el desarrollo de las relaciones entre los dos partidos y dos paises y otros problemas de interes comun y llego al consenso.
					
					  Esto impulso mas el desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad China-Corea, subrayo.
					
					  Prosiguio que el Partido del Trabajo de Corea fundado por el Presidente es el partido con las gloriosas tradiciones revolucionarias y gran combatividad y subrayo que bajo la direccion del partido, el pueblo coreano logro grandes avances en la revolucion y la construccion.
					
					  Deseo al pueblo coreano mayores exitos en la edificacion de una gran potencia prospera siguiendo la direccion del PTC encabezado por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					  Destaco que consolidar incesantemente la tradicional amistad China-Corea es la orientacion invariable del partido y el gobierno de China y expreso su conviccion de que gracias a los esfuerzos conjuntos de ambas partes, las relaciones entre los dos partidos y paises se desarrollaran a la etapa mas alta. 
					
					  El mismo dia, el jefe del Departamento de Enlace Internacional del CC del PCCh, Wang Jiarui, departio con la delegacion coreana en un clima amistoso.

articles.title: Cuadros ven funcion del Comite de Radio y Television de Corea
articles.content:
Cuadros ven funcion del Comite de Radio y Television de Corea
Pyongyang, 6 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 6 en el Teatro de Arte Mansudae la funcion del grupo artistico del Comite de Radio y Television de Corea dedicada al 65o aniversario de su fundacion.
					  La vieron los funcionarios directivos del Estado, el presidente de partido amigo, los funcionarios de entidades sociales, ministerios y organos centrales y los otros de las instituciones del partido y la administracion de esta capital.
					
					  En la ocasion se presentaron diversas piezas tales como la poesia y narracion "Los 3 Generales del monte Paektu y la radio de Corea", el coro "Los 40 millones de coreanos cantan al Lider", el cuarteto mixto y coro "Gloria al gran partido nuestro", la poesia acompanada de narracion y cancion "Cantamos regazo afectuoso".
					
					  Los ejecutantes mostraron bien el gran orgullo y felicidad de los locutores, periodistas, redactores y empleados que han crecido en el regazo de los Grandes Hombres sin pares y apoyan fielmente la causa del partido y el lider con el pincel y microfono de la revolucion.
					
					  Las piezas como el canto homofono de tambor "Estamos en la ofensiva general", el drama tomado de una historia real "'Mecha' de Chon Pok y Man Kil" y la charla humoristica "Toltoli y Samnyo: 'Enfoquemos'" dejaron muy impresionados a los espectadores porque reflejaron claramente la politica y el espiritu de la epoca.
					
					  La funcion demostro la justeza y la vitalidad de la orientacion del Partido del Trabajo de Corea sobre las actividades artisticas y culturales masivas y el noble mundo espiritual de los hombres de prensa de la epoca del Songun que cumplen la honrosa mision de los trompeteros de marcha en la construccion de la gran potencia prospera. 
					
					　Los espectadores enviaron aplausos efusivos a los ejecutantes.

articles.title: Regresa delegacion militar de RPDC
articles.content:
Regresa delegacion militar de RPDC
Pyongyang, 6 de noviembre (ATCC) -- La delegacion militar de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea presidida por el vicemariscal del Ejercito Popular de Corea Ri Yong Ho, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y jefe del Estado Mayor General del EPC, regreso el dia 6 a Pyongyang luego de concluir su visita a la Republica de Cuba.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam expresa condolencias a Raul Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam expresa condolencias a Raul Castro Ruz
Pyongyang, 6 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 6 un telegrama de condolencias a Raul Castro Ruz, presidente de los Consejos de Estado y de Ministros de la Republica de Cuba, en relacion con que ocurrio el dia 4 en este pais caribeno la caida de un avion dejando como saldo muchas perdidas humanas.
					  En la misiva el remitente expresa profunda compasion y condolencias a las victimas y sus familiares y desea que el destinatario y el gobierno cubano eliminen lo mas pronto posible las consecuencias del accidente aereo.
